moves.1. d4: a hopeless game when looking at the grade difference but it is always good playing someone who is a grandmaster to learn that tiny bit extra!
moves.1... b5: an opening i don't usually play but one i decided to try
moves.2. e4: straight into the attack and the control of the centre
moves.2... c6: i defend. now imagine if both our queens and kings were the other way around- white would have had a checkmate:)
moves.4. a4: white wants to get those pawns out of its way
moves.5. Bc4: more control of the centre for white now!
moves.6... d5: i now want more control of the centre
moves.8... Bd7: but nothing great for white there
moves.10... Bd6: now that knight is a certain annoyance!
moves.11... O-O: lets get my king out of the way
moves.12. f4: more defence or should i say attck
moves.13... Qb6: i attempt to take the lead
moves.14... Ne8: making my knight escape that awful position
moves.15... Qxd4: but i'll have that pawn first thank you
moves.18... Qxb5: but i can now take the lead by two on the GRANDMASTER
moves.19... Qxe2+: a pleasant swap off for me
moves.21... Nc4: i may as well keep us even
moves.23... Nb6: pull it to protection- my i'm in an ugly position
moves.26. Kf3: that's prevented my lead but got that king out a bit too early
moves.27... Nb8d7: this helps me advance this knight
moves.29... Kd6: pull my king out of range!
moves.32... h6: i can feel brewing trouble for my weak looking pawns
moves.35. Rg8: why didn't white play that earlier
moves.35... g5: not much of a better option!
moves.36... gxf4: keep getting those pawns out of range
moves.37... h5: what to do with that pawn
moves.41... b3: why don't i try and get a queen
moves.42. Rh8: gets the rook out the way to advance that pawn
moves.42... Ne7: i think must pull my knights back to prevent a queen!
moves.43... Nb6: i need to do something- quick
moves.47. Ra6: that guy is giving no mercy
moves.50... Nh6: getting away and stopping any further threat of a queen for a while
moves.53... Ndxf7: but i'd rather lose two knights than let white get a queen
moves.54. Nxf7: white plays right into the game
moves.54... Ng8: i'm not taking that knight simply to be followed by Ra7+
moves.56. Nxh6: maybe i could achieve a stalemate
moves.56... Kb7: i probably still lose if i get tht rook for free
moves.57. Rd6: but white doesn't want to make the game anymore challenging
moves.59... Kc7: i got for another hopelss attack
moves.62... Kb8: i play my only move left dreaming for victory
moves.65. Re8#: here the game comes to a finish with an expected and the inevitable CHECKMATE! what i would have wanted to know was what had i played that mainly caused my loss- queen takes that tempting pawn? or simply the opening i played! dunno! i lost but i definitely learned one thing: never get to conceited or should i say over yourselves when you get in the lead- a quick downfall is always likely! thanks for reading!!
